brief_summary.textblock:
This register will evaluate the use of different antithrombotic therapies, combinations of
      different drugs routinely used during any stage of hospital admission, with their timing,
      dosage and mode of administration, in patients with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome
      in the Italian Coronary Care Unit during a study period of three weeks

clinical_study.brief_title: EYESHOT (EmploYEd Antithrombotic Therapies in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndromes HOspitalized in iTalian Coronary Care Units)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  All consecutive patients discharged with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome ( Non
             ST elevation or ST Elevation) undergoing myocardial revascularization or conservative
             treatment , admitted to the Coronary Care Unit during the observation period
             established.

          -  Age ≥ 18 years

          -  Signed informed consent

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  Patients enrolled in clinical trials of intervention

          -  Diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome caused by confounding comorbidities (eg . Trauma
             or surgery after non- cardiac )

          -  Patients already enrolled in eyeshot from another center.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients  with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome consecutively admitted in the
        Italian Cardiac Care Unit, located in hospitals with and without cardiac cath lab and
        cardiac surgery, during a period of 3 weeks

clinical_study.official_title: EmploYEd Antithrombotic Therapies in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndromes HOspitalized in iTalian CCUs Registry

primary_outcome.measure: Antithrombotic drugs in patient undergoing percutaneous transluminal coronary angiography, coronary artery bypass graft  or no coronary revascularization
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average period of 7 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average period of 7 days
